module_summaries.summary:
Line 1: Users can log in or access account recovery options.
Line 2: Displays login form and error messages if credentials are incorrect.

Line 1: Users can retrieve forgotten login information.
Line 2: Displays customer lookup form and error messages if no match is found.

Line 1: Users can register a new account.
Line 2: Displays registration form and success confirmation.

Line 1: Users can open a new savings or checking account.
Line 2: Displays account type selection and funding source options.

Line 1: Users can view a summary of all their accounts.
Line 2: Displays account numbers, balances, and available amounts.

Line 1: Users can transfer funds between accounts.
Line 2: Displays transfer form with source and destination account options.

Line 1: Users can make bill payments to specified payees.
Line 2: Displays payment form and confirmation message upon success.

Line 1: Users can search for transactions by various criteria.
Line 2: Displays search results in a table format.

Line 1: Users can update their personal profile information.
Line 2: Displays profile update form and confirmation message.

Line 1: Users can apply for a loan with specified terms.
Line 2: Displays loan application form and approval status.

Line 1: Users can securely log out of their account.
Line 2: Displays logout process and redirects to login page.

test_cases.title: Successful login with valid username and password
test_cases.expected_result: User is redirected to account dashboard

test_cases.title: Successful login with valid email and password
test_cases.expected_result: User is redirected to account dashboard

test_cases.title: Successful recovery with valid customer details
test_cases.workflow: Find login information using Customer Lookup form
steps: Click on Find My Login Info button
test_cases.expected_result: Recovery details displayed

test_cases.title: Register new account with valid details
steps: Select a valid state from the dropdown
Enter the same password in Confirm Password
test_cases.expected_result: System creates the new account and automatically logs the user in

test_cases.title: Successfully open a new account with valid inputs
test_cases.preconditions: User is logged in and on the Open New Account page
steps: Select a valid funding source with sufficient balance
Click on Open New Account button
test_cases.expected_result: A new account is opened, $100.00 is deducted from the selected source account, credited to the new account, and a unique account number is generated

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the new account appears in the account summary
post_verifications.matched_test_title: Verify Accounts Overview displays account number
post_verifications.execution_note: Run this test after creating a new account to verify the account number appears in the Account Overview.
post_verifications.reason: This test checks for the presence of an account number, which is part of the requirement, but does not verify the balance or the uniqueness of the account number.
post_verifications.suggested_manual_step: Manually verify that the new account has a $100.00 balance and that the account number is unique.

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the source account balance is reduced by $100.00
post_verifications.execution_note: Run this test after the action to verify the balance is displayed, but it does not check for the $100 deduction.
post_verifications.reason: The test case verifies that the balance is displayed in the Account Overview module, but it does not specifically check for a $100 deduction.
post_verifications.suggested_manual_step: Manually verify that the balance reflects a $100 deduction after running this test.

coverage_gaps: This test checks for the presence of an account number, which is part of the requirement, but does not verify the balance or the uniqueness of the account number.
The test case verifies that the balance is displayed in the Account Overview module, but it does not specifically check for a $100 deduction.

test_cases.title: Verify Account Services sidebar is displayed
steps: Check if the Account Services sidebar is visible on the page
test_cases.expected_result: Account Services sidebar is displayed

test_cases.title: Verify all actions are listed in Account Services sidebar
steps: Check if all actions (Open New Account, Accounts Overview, Transfer Funds, Bill Pay, Find Transactions, Update Contact Info, Request Loan, Log Out) are listed in the Account Services sidebar
test_cases.expected_result: All actions are listed in the Account Services sidebar

test_cases.title: Verify Accounts Overview displays account number
steps: Check if the Accounts Overview section displays the account number
test_cases.expected_result: Account number is displayed in the Accounts Overview section

test_cases.title: Verify Accounts Overview displays Balance
steps: Check if the Accounts Overview section displays the Balance
test_cases.expected_result: Balance is displayed in the Accounts Overview section

test_cases.title: Verify Accounts Overview displays Available Amount
steps: Check if the Accounts Overview section displays the Available Amount
test_cases.expected_result: Available Amount is displayed in the Accounts Overview section

test_cases.title: Verify Accounts Overview displays combined total balance
steps: Check if the Accounts Overview section displays the combined total balance
test_cases.expected_result: Combined total balance is displayed in the Accounts Overview section

test_cases.title: Verify clicking 'Log Out' logs the user out
steps: Click on 'Log Out' in the Account Services sidebar
test_cases.expected_result: User is logged out and redirected to the login page

test_cases.title: Verify clicking 'Open New Account' navigates to the correct page
steps: Click on 'Open New Account' in the Account Services sidebar
test_cases.expected_result: User is navigated to the Open New Account page

test_cases.title: Verify clicking 'Transfer Funds' navigates to the correct page
steps: Click on 'Transfer Funds' in the Account Services sidebar
test_cases.expected_result: User is navigated to the Transfer Funds page

test_cases.title: Verify clicking 'Bill Pay' navigates to the correct page
steps: Click on 'Bill Pay' in the Account Services sidebar
test_cases.expected_result: User is navigated to the Bill Pay page

test_cases.title: Verify clicking 'Find Transactions' navigates to the correct page
steps: Click on 'Find Transactions' in the Account Services sidebar
test_cases.expected_result: User is navigated to the Find Transactions page

test_cases.title: Verify clicking 'Update Contact Info' navigates to the correct page
steps: Click on 'Update Contact Info' in the Account Services sidebar
test_cases.expected_result: User is navigated to the Update Contact Info page

test_cases.title: Verify clicking 'Request Loan' navigates to the correct page
steps: Click on 'Request Loan' in the Account Services sidebar
test_cases.expected_result: User is navigated to the Request Loan page

test_cases.title: Transfer funds with valid inputs
test_cases.preconditions: User is logged in and on the Transfer Funds page
test_cases.expected_result: Transaction is processed

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the transfer status is successful
post_verifications.matched_test_title: Transfer funds with maximum allowable amount
post_verifications.execution_note: Run this test and verify if the transfer status is marked as successful after processing.
post_verifications.reason: The test case checks if the transaction is processed, but it does not explicitly verify the transfer status as successful.
post_verifications.suggested_manual_step: After executing the test, manually check the transfer status to ensure it is marked as successful.

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the source and destination account balances are updated correctly
post_verifications.reason: None of the test cases verify the specific requirement of checking both source and destination account balances for a transfer operation. They only verify the presence of balance information in the Account Overview.
post_verifications.suggested_manual_step: Manually perform a transfer and check the source and destination account balances in the Account Overview to ensure they reflect the transfer amount correctly.

coverage_gaps: The test case checks if the transaction is processed, but it does not explicitly verify the transfer status as successful.

None of the test cases verify the specific requirement of checking both source and destination account balances for a transfer operation. They only verify the presence of balance information in the Account Overview.

test_cases.title: Successfully send payment with all valid inputs
steps: Re-enter the valid account number for verification
Select a valid from account number
test_cases.expected_result: A confirmation message appears upon successful transfer

post_verifications.ideal: Verify the payment status is successful
post_verifications.matched_test_title: Successfully send payment with maximum length inputs
post_verifications.execution_note: Run this test to verify that a confirmation message appears, indicating a successful payment.
post_verifications.reason: The test case checks for a confirmation message upon successful payment, which partially verifies the requirement. However, it does not explicitly check the payment_status.
post_verifications.suggested_manual_step: After executing the test, manually verify the payment_status in the system to ensure it is marked as successful.

coverage_gaps: The test case checks for a confirmation message upon successful payment, which partially verifies the requirement. However, it does not explicitly check the payment_status.

This test checks for the presence of an account number, which is part of the requirement, but does not verify the balance or the uniqueness of the account number.
The test case checks for a confirmation message upon successful payment, which partially verifies the requirement. However, it does not explicitly check the payment_status.
The test case verifies that the balance is displayed in the Account Overview module, but it does not specifically check for a $100 deduction.

None of the test cases verify the specific requirement of checking both source and destination account balances for a transfer operation. They only verify the presence of balance information in the Account Overview.
